section.name: Upgrade
section.p: This document describes how to upgrade the Sawmill software package for versions 8.5+. The current licenses apply to all 8.x.x.x versions.

section.name: Download Software
section.p: See Download Software section of Installation for instructions on downloading the software.

section.name: Software Upgrade
section.p: This section describes the procedure for upgrading a previously installed version of Sawmill to a newer version.

p.i: Note: The following procedure needs to be completed for pdsrpt1 only. The instructions will explicitly denote instructions for upgrading pdsrpt2.

ol.li: Place the downloaded Sawmill tar in the /home/pds directory

Navigate to /home/pds and enter the following command from the command line:
% gunzip -c (sawmill.tar.gz) | tar xf -
A directory called sawmill is created containing the software and configuration.

Move the directory to a more version-specific location so it is maintained:
% mv sawmill sawmill8.6.3.1

Run upgrade-sawmill to remove the Sawmill default configurations and copy the PDS Engineering-specific configurations from the old installation.
# Usage: upgrade-sawmill <new-LogAnalysisInfo> ./upgrade-sawmill /home/pds/sawmill8.6.1.3/LogAnalysisInfo
Note: This assumes /report_service/LogAnalysisInfo is home to current installation's LogAnalysisInfo. Update the script if needed.

To run Sawmill, execute the following commands:
cd /home/pds/sawmill8.6.3.1 nohup ./sawmill -ws t -v e > ~/sawmill_<current_date_in_YYYYMMDD_formate>.log 2>&1&
Note: Be sure to modify this command, as needed for the shell being used, to ensure Sawmill runs as a daemon process and output is redirected into .
